713616f-a.text:
52nd Street, Broadway front of ~154. (Before Roconstruction).
President Borough of Mlanhatton.
;REDDTT LINE IMPERATIVE.  November 23 1921.

713617f-a.text:
52nd Street Broadway.. (Before Reconstruction).
Prosident Borough of Manhatten.
CREDIT LINE ITERATIVE. November 23, 1921.

717572f-a.text:
Broadway at and adjoining the N.E. corner of 52nd Street, with the new Karle Building in the centre.  The north side of 52nd Street looking east from Broadway is also shown.

1921.

Gift of E.M. Jenks.

Neg # 3195

713615f-b.text:
(1)
52nd Street, north side, west from, but not including, Broadway. In the foreground is the excavation on the site of the old Hotel Albany, where the Hollywood Theatre will be
erected.
October 29, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2 and 3)
A detail of same as viewed in an eastward direction and showing the Guild Theatre at No. 245 West. This set consists of a negative and a
positive.
September 1935.
W.P.A. Fhcto.  NNg : :(E9:

717567f-a.text:
Broadway at 52nd Street, showing the four corners, seen from the roof of the Capitol Theatre across the excavation on the site
of the Hotel Albany.
October 24, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

717568f-a.text:
Broadway at the S.E. corner of 52nd Street, showing also 52nd Street, north side, from Broadway to Seventh Avenue.
October 20, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
